result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis M Krey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Travis M Krey in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 2 & 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 2 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs,  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  On Ct. 3 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 1 year, concurrent to Ct. 2.  Conditions of probation include: $243.00 costs, AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample. 3 days jail credit.

Defendant Travis M Krey in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested by Atty Riek.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
